techmeme.title: Sources: General Catalyst is in the very early stages of considering an IPO, which would make it first US VC firm to go public (Dan Primack/Axios)
When asked about UK's order for an iCloud backdoor, Trump says he told PM Keir Starmer that UK "can't do this" and it is something "you hear about with China" (Chance Miller/9to5Mac)
Intel delays the opening of its first Ohio chip factory to 2030 due to financial struggles; the $28B project was originally scheduled to begin operating in 2025 (Max Filby/The Columbus Dispatch)
Filings: CFPB employees say the agency's Trump-appointed leadership plans to fire nearly all its 1,700 employees while "winding down" the agency (Hugh Son/CNBC)
Microsoft says it will shut down Skype on May 5 and directs users to migrate all their contacts and chat data to Teams; Skype had 36M+ DAUs in 2023 (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
